RECORD.DD_COMM_TEXT: - Each page has two stubs and a check in any order.
- A stub has a limited number of lines for invoice info.
- Rows beyond stub max requires continued and void check.
- On one page, the info in the two stubs will match except
the Vendor copy will not include GL info, tho the Accting
copy may include GL (based on param setting).
- The Jasper ver of AP Checks allows on-the-fly stub/check
ordering (based on O/E form selection).
- This work file collects the data for a check run and
allows jasper to drive through a recordset for each stub
on a page (ptr handling) and VOID checks on stub overflow.
- .aon o'lay fills this table w/data for subsequent .prcs.

RECORD.DD_DESCRIPTION: AP Jasper Checks page of Check

RECORD.DD_ATTR_LABL: Is this record a total line?

RECORD.DD_COMM_TEXT: Checks may be multi-page. Elem used by Jasper Checks to
track which page of a specific check is being written so
logic knows things such as when to print VOID or check amt.
Used to tell Jasper checks' print routines the section type
so that the routines' SELECTs can project the correct data.
A=Accounting Stub, V=Vendor Stub, C=Check
Elem used by Jasper Checks to point to result set row within
a print section. Check stub data may force multi-page check,
When this happens, the Jasper Detail routine, which must fit
in the stub area, has to know where to take up when it gets
to the next page.
this is a test comment
- Used in AP Checks Jasper print to flag total lines.
Text of pay 'Exactly' amt on AP Check
Masked Check Amt or VOID for AP Check itself.
